name: Tan Dinh Church
short_desc: Vietnamüáªüá≥Ho Chi Minh„ÄêTan Dinh Catholic Church„Äë(Pink Church) Tan Dinh Church  Tan Dinh Church, also known as the Pink Church, is located in District 3 of Ho Chi Minh City. It was completed on December 16, 1876. Its pink exterior is very eye-catching and is said to have been painted in 1957. The overall style is Gothic, but the decorative details have some Romanesque and Baroque influences. The entire building is currently painted pink, and the facade includes a main tower and two secondary towers. There is a 3-meter-high bronze cross on the top of the 52.6-meter-high main tower. There are five bells inside, with a total weight of 5.5 tons. Not only is the exterior of the church all pink, the interior is also decorated in pink. There are mass times every day and visitors can go inside to visit.  Address: 289 Hai B√† Tr∆∞ng, ‚Äã‚ÄãPh∆∞·ªùng 8, Qu·∫≠n 3, H·ªì Ch√≠ Minh, Vietnam Tickets: Free Time: 8:00-11:00 14:00-17:00
long_desc: Tan Dinh Catholic Church is located in the third district of Ho Chi Minh City. It was built in 1876 and the walls are in eye-catching pink, which is said to have been painted in 1957. The all pink appearance makes it look like a pink castle. Visitors can enter the Church and feel the atmosphere during the Mass. Many locals like taking wedding pictures here.
address: 289 Hai B√† Tr∆∞ng, Ph∆∞·ªùng V√µ Th·ªã S√°u, Qu·∫≠n 3, H·ªì Ch√≠ Minh 70000, Vietnam

name: War Remnants Museum
short_desc: Yes, it's very wonderful and great to see the history of the war.the human can understand how a war changes the life of the human and the entire country/world.
long_desc: The War Remnants Museum is one of the five outstanding museums in Vietnam. The War Remnants Museum is a place to call for world peace. The museum is not only a place for patriotic education in Vietnam, but also an important place for tourists to visit. The content of the exhibition is divided into two parts: indoor and outdoor. The indoor part uses pictures, maps and text to describe how the US military used advanced weapons and inhumane methods to kill Vietnamese during the Vietnam War. Even though the name of the museum has changed, the content has not changed. The interpretive languages used in the museum include Vietnamese, English and Chinese. Interestingly, the vast majority of these images depicting U.S. atrocities are from the United States. There are real objects on display in the museum. The outdoor part is a display of aircraft, artillery shells and various gas bombs used by the US military during the Vietnam War. There is also a French-made guillotine shipped to Vietnam in the early 20th century, which was fully used between 1959-1960 and is chilling to watch. There are eight themed exhibition halls in the museum, and the display themes are: historical truth, photo collection of current affairs of international photojournalists who died in the Indochina war, photo collection of current affairs of Japanese photographers, prison system, crimes of the war of aggression, "white dove" children The Department of Education and people from all over the world supported the Vietnam War of Resistance.
address: Ph∆∞·ªùng 6, District 3, Ho Chi Minh City 700000, Vietnam

name: Independence Palace
short_desc: This place is a 5 story building and some floors are not allowed for visitors.The place is worth it and there are big gardon old meetings ,hall and many more.....
long_desc: Reunification Palace was once the office of the French Governor in Vietnam. It is now a venue for government meetings and heads of state receptions. It is also an open historical site for both domestic and foreign visitors. The Palace is 3 stories high with two side buildings and a basement. There is a luxurious meeting room on the first floor; a credential submission room, a presidential VIP room, a banquet hall, and a presidential office on the second floor; and a movie room and entertainment room on the third floor. Reunification Palace is surrounded by trees, with a large lawn in front of the main entrance and a fountain.
address: Ben Thanh, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam

name: Pham Ngu Lao
short_desc: Vietnamüáªüá≥Ho Chi Minh„ÄêPham Ngu Lao Street„Äë Pham Ngu Lao Street  Pham Ngu Lao Street is the most lively place in Ho Chi Minh City. There are many hotels, restaurants, travel agencies, cafes, bars and shops on this street. It is very lively here  Address: Near September 23 Park, search "ƒê. B√πi Vi·ªán" on the navigation
long_desc: Pham Ngu Lao Street is a place that appeals to backpackers. There are various grades of hotels and budget hotels all over the street, roadside shops, travel agency agents, foreign currency exchange points, restaurants of various flavors, western restaurants, bars, coffee houses and local specialties. Commodity stores are row upon row. The night at Pham Ngu Lao Street is very charming, the streets become lively, some quiet coffee shops during the day turn into lively bars.
address: Pham Ngu Lao, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam

name: Saigon River Princess Cruise
short_desc: One of the highlights of Hanoi tourism is the cruise. I took part in the Saigon River Princess cruise. The internal facilities were very good. I ordered a set menu of five dishes in advance. I was very satisfied with it. The dishes and service were not much different from those in a high-end restaurant. After the meal, I went to the upper deck to enjoy the cool breeze and the night view of Ho Chi Minh City on both sides. It was very nice. The band and singers also performed in a very good atmosphere. I can recommend everyone to participate in such activities.
long_desc: Admire the city's landmarks as you float down the river; sights such as Thu Thiem Bridge and Vietnam Telecom Tower can be seen from the deck. Dine on a variety of local and international dishes, including vegetarian and children's menus. Don‚Äôt miss your chance to sail to the city in the evening on an unforgettable dinner cruise with Saigon River Princess CruiseÔºÅ

name: Landmark 81 Sky View Observatory
short_desc: Beautiful views of the entire city. You also get a nice little portrait picture of yourself and you can play a VR game climbing Landmark 81 (Can be a little scary). Overall a great experience and would definitely recommend to everyone.
long_desc: Located in Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam, the Landmark 81 Observation Deck is a great spot to enjoy panoramic views of the city. This modern skyscraper has become one of the city's landmarks with its spectacular height and unique architectural design. Located on the upper floors of the building, visitors can overlook the bustling scene of Ho Chi Minh City and enjoy the beautiful scene of the Mekong River winding through the city, especially at sunset, when the city's skyline is dyed golden, and the scenery is particularly spectacular. The observation deck is equipped with high-powered telescopes and interactive information screens to help visitors identify and understand the city's major landmarks and historical background. In addition, there is a cafe and Souvenir shop in the observation deck, where visitors can slowly appreciate the charm of the city while enjoying delicious food. The Landmark 81 Observation Deck is not only an ideal place for sightseeing, but also a window to experience the vitality and modernization of Ho Chi Minh City!

name: Coffee Making in Ho Chi Minh City
long_desc: Ho Chi Minh City, as the vibrant capital of Vietnam, has a thriving coffee culture. Here, you will start a passionate and creative coffee making experience and feel the unique coffee charm of this city. Rich experience: Experience courses will always learn about Vietnamese coffee, introduce you to the different coffee producing areas and flavors; learn to roast coffee beans and taste coffee; there are also classic Vietnamese drip coffee, egg coffee, condensed milk coffee and other coffee making methods, which will give you a deep understanding of every aspect of coffee making. New teachers: The number of students in the class is controlled in a small class to create an active learning atmosphere. Everyone can communicate with each other, share ideas, and improve their coffee making skills in a relaxed and pleasant environment. The instructors are young baristas from well-known local coffee shops. They not only have a solid grasp of traditional coffee skills, but also have a keen sense of international coffee trends. Through vivid teaching methods, we can inspire your creativity and let you appreciate the infinite possibilities of coffee making. A full range of items are provided: The class time is relatively flexible, and reservations can be made conveniently through the online platform. A variety of high-quality Vietnamese coffee beans are provided, from the mellow Arabica on the plateau to the fruity Robusta. At the same time, it is equipped with various special auxiliary materials, such as coconut milk, condensed milk, spices, etc., to help you create your own coffee. Most of the stores are located in bustling and lively neighborhoods, and the stores are equipped with advanced coffee roasters, electronic grinders, espresso machines and other equipment. These modern tools can not only ensure the accuracy of coffee making, but also meet the production needs of different styles of coffee. Experiencing coffee making in Ho Chi Minh City is not only the making of a drink, but also a cultural experience. The coffee in Ho Chi Minh City is not only famous for its unique flavor, but also attracts tourists to explore with its rich production process and historical heritage. You will become a coffee-making expert, engrave the coffee memory of Ho Chi Minh City, and start a vibrant coffee journey.

name: Bitexco Financial Tower
short_desc: A most good to when your in Ho Chi Minh City vietnam.  This will not disappoint you on your travels to this place. Very easy to navigate your way to the front gate to buy the tickets before you know it you're on the way out. The Skyline View is amazing during the day but most impressive at night as the city lights make the city look magical
long_desc: Ho Chi Minh City Financial Tower is also known as the "roof" of the city. The tower is 262 meters high and has a total of 68 floors. The observation deck is located on the 49th floor. The building is located in the center of the first county of Hu City, invested and constructed by Pingming Import and Export Production and Operation Co., Ltd. The famous American architect Carlos Zapata used the lotus shape, a symbol of Vietnamese culture, in his design. Urban landmarks often become a benchmark for the economic development level of a city or a country. Ho Chi Minh's financial tower seems to be announcing to the world that Vietnam is not only a beautiful scenery, but also a gradually booming economy. However, in Ho Chi Minh City, which retains the elegant style of 19th-century French colonial architecture, this slightly abrupt modernist building is a bit out of place, and some people think that building such a high-rise in the city center violates the principles of historic preservation. The observation deck on the 49th floor of the building has a bird's-eye view of the entire Ho Chi Minh City and the crooked Mekong River. There is a special entrance to buy tickets and take the elevator directly. Although the souvenirs are a little expensive, the use of high-powered telescopes is free.
address: B·∫øn Ngh√©, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam

name: Golden Dragon Water Puppet Theater
short_desc: The experience isn‚Äôt expensive and you get your moneys worth. I enjoyed the show it was as the box explained a famous old puppet show an I would advise everyone to experience it at its cheap price and to see a bit of local culture. If taking kids it is 1hr long so if you don‚Äôt plan to stay the whole time then please don‚Äôt sit in the front rows.
long_desc: Water puppet show is Vietnam's "national quintessence" and one of Vietnam's characteristic traditional folk stage shows. It has a history of more than 800 years. Although "water puppets" originated in North Vietnam, they have been slowly relocated to Ho Chi Minh City over the past decade due to their popularity with foreign tourists. The performance method is to set up a stage on the pool, and the actors who are immersed in the water in the background manipulate the puppets with long lines or bamboo poles, and sing, read and play with the accompaniment on the spot, so that the puppets can vividly interpret various Vietnamese folklore stories. There are many performance venues for water puppet shows, especially the Golden Dragon Water Puppet Theater, which lasts about 45 minutes. ‚ñ≥ The show performed on the water ‚ñ≥ Use live Vietnamese traditional instruments ‚ñ≥ The show is mainly about Vietnamese folktales and legends
address: 55B ƒê. Nguy·ªÖn Th·ªã Minh Khai, Ph∆∞·ªùng B·∫øn Th√†nh, Qu·∫≠n 1, H·ªì Ch√≠ Minh, Vietnam

name: Bui Vien Walking Street
short_desc: It can be called a holy place for travelers to Ho Chi Minh.  There are bars and clubs on both sides of the 800m street, as well as restaurants, massage shops, and various shops.  There are also cheap hotels, and many foreigners stay in hostels.
long_desc: Bui Vien Street is one of the busier streets in Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam, a vibrant place. There are many bars, restaurants and cafes on Bui Vien Street, offering a wide variety of food and drinks. The atmosphere here is very international, where visitors can meet people from all over the world and enjoy a lively nightlife.
address: ƒê. B√πi Vi·ªán, Ph∆∞·ªùng Ph·∫°m Ng≈© L√£o, Qu·∫≠n 1, H·ªì Ch√≠ Minh, Vietnam

name: Jesus Christ Statue
short_desc: Jesus Mountain is located in the southeast of Ho Chi Minh City. It is named after the world's largest statue of Jesus built on the mountain. The stone statue of Jesus stretches its hands and faces the South China Sea. Climb up the stone steps to the foot of the statue and enter to visit. Standing at the shoulder of the statue, you can overlook the beautiful scenery of Vung Tau City, which is as picturesque as poetry.
long_desc: The citizens of Vietnam were deeply influenced by the colonial rule of the past, and Catholicism played a pivotal role in Vietnam. The Jesus statue located on the Yingshan Ridge of Jesus Mountain in Vung Tau City is the same as the Jesus statue in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. It is a rare large-scale Jesus statue in the world. The statue was built by the United States in 1971 during the Vietnam War, and the statue was also intended to protect the city of Vung Tau.
address: 01 B√† R·ªãa, Ph∆∞·ªùng 2, V≈©ng T√†u, B√† R·ªãa - V≈©ng T√†u 70000, Vietnam

short_desc: this place is so beautiful and peaceful. it's just a short lane nearby many attractions in hcmc. there are a few coffee shops and even book cafe for you to relax and enjoy the ambience Tips: walkable to many attractions. avoid buying souvenirs here as the price is higher than ben thanh market
long_desc: Book Street is a wide pedestrian street in Ho Chi Minh City, lined with bookstores, cafes and restaurants. There are many books and cultural works related to literature and art, where visitors can read, shop and participate in various cultural activities.

name: Cat Cat Village
short_desc: It feels really good to enjoy the breeze and sun at the Con Dao beach in Vung Tau. I spent the whole afternoon calming down and chatting. It was extremely cozy and comfortable. I didn‚Äôt feel tired. It was great.
long_desc: Con Dao is located in Vung Tau City, Vietnam. It consists of 15 large and small islands. It is 185 kilometers away from Vung Tau City and 230 kilometers away from Saigon. Hell Island, which was once a political prisoner of the Viet Cong, now has the famous SixSenses Hotel, which is simple and clean.
address: Con Dao, Ba Ria - Vung Tau, Vietnam

name: Tue Thanh Assembly Hall
short_desc: Tianhou Temple, also known as Suicheng Guild Hall, was first built in the 25th year of Emperor Qianlong's reign in the Qing Dynasty (1761). The main hall is dedicated to Mazu, who blesses safe voyages. There are many colorful pottery decorations inside and outside the temple, which are based on Chinese allusions. There are incense coils hanging high, and people have been offering incense and worshiping.
long_desc: Thean Hou Temple is located in the Chinese district of Saigon and is the religious center of the local Chinese. Founded in 1761, Thean Hou Temple is one of the grand and ancient Chinese temples in Ho Chi Minh City with historical and cultural value. The ancient Chinese architectural method is adopted, the brick walls are not exposed, and the pottery decorations inside and outside the temple are based on Chinese allusions. Tianhou Palace preserves many precious cultural relics, such as the bronze bell and bronze incense tripod cast in the 60th year of Qianlong in the Qing Dynasty, and the large plaque "Hanhongguangda" hung on the nave of the temple in the fifth year of Jiaqing in the Qing Dynasty (1800). A pair of stone lions in front of the temple have been standing for more than a hundred years. The courtyard of Tianhou Palace is not large. There is a courtyard in the courtyard, and there is a patio in the inner courtyard. There is a large incense burner in the middle, where Chinese people burn incense and make wishes. On the ridges and eaves of the Tianhou Palace, exquisite gray sculpture reliefs can be seen everywhere, which are colorful and lifelike.
address: 710 ƒê. Nguy·ªÖn Tr√£i, Ph∆∞·ªùng 11, Qu·∫≠n 5, H·ªì Ch√≠ Minh, Vietnam

short_desc: This is large statue a former president ho chi Minh situated at the end of nguyen street near to the people community building. It's an excellent tribute to their celebrate president. The statue stand out and brighten it's surrounding .

name: Saigon Opera House
short_desc: The AO show was amazing and some parts were actually hilarious! Go early for their mini tour of the Opera house at 5pm, where you get to experience a 5-mins viewing from the ‚ÄúWOW‚Äù section.
long_desc: The Ho Chi Minh City Opera House, also known as Saigon Theater, is a European-style Gothic building. The exterior wall of the Opera House has various reliefs and patterns, all of which were built according to the same type of opera house in France at that time, which is very exquisite. Ordinary tourists are not allowed to visit, unless they buy tickets to watch the show. At the top of the huge arch on the front of the Opera House, there are two female angels with wings on their backs holding the holy qin. The position below the arch is the shape of two goddesses holding the gate with both hands. There are also various gorgeous and exquisite reliefs on the outer wall. Savor. The Opera House is not open to ordinary tourists, unless you buy tickets to watch the performances. The Opera House combines Western and local characteristics of Vietnam. Generally, a performance is more than 500,000 VND, and the performance is very Vietnamese. Nearby attractions around the Opera House include City Hall, Saigon Notre-Dame Cathedral and Central Post Office, which are also within a 15-minute walk and can be arranged for a day tour. In addition, there are many high-end restaurants around.
address: 07 C√¥ng tr∆∞·ªùng Lam S∆°n, B·∫øn Ngh√©, Qu·∫≠n 1, H·ªì Ch√≠ Minh 710212, Vietnam

name: Ben Thanh Market
short_desc: tempat untuk beli pakain,servivour,beg ,jam dan lain-lain..syurga pakain untuk wanita
long_desc: This market is the largest trading market in Ho Chi Minh City, selling everything from food, daily necessities, and handicrafts. There are all kinds of souvenirs, and a big clock stands in the circular square outside the market, which is very eye-catching. The market is very lively every day, with people coming and going. There are many restaurants and food stalls inside and outside the market, selling authentic Vietnamese snacks at low prices.
address: Ben Thanh, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam

name: A O Show - Lune Production (Saigon Opera House)
short_desc: Visiting the Saigon Opera House is an unforgettable experience! Quick, queue-free entry, a welcome drink, and numerous photo zones create a wonderful atmosphere, allowing you to fully appreciate the building's colonial architecture. The one-hour "A O" show is a captivating blend of bamboo circus, contemporary dance, and traditional music from the region. It vividly portrays Vietnam's transition from rural life to urbanization. Everything is intuitively understandable, even without knowing the local language. After the performance, you can take photos with the artists. Highly recommended!
long_desc: Enjoy the Vietnamese bamboo circus - the folk harmony of the Vietnamese countryside mixed with the youthful melodies of the Vietnamese city Witness the eye-catching combination of rustic "homegrown" props such as basket boats and bamboo baskets The play recreates the scene of busy boats or the noise of urban traffic under a very delicate combination of ethnic instruments and modern beatbox sounds. Be captivated by a new circus technique that combines acrobatics and contemporary dance by professional dancers touring more than 15 countries Vietmam's contrasting portrait: Vietnam's peaceful country life versus the noise and irony of urbanization Vienamese Bamboo Cirus: Combing story -telling circus, unique live music, and creative use of bamboo to form an awe inspiring performance art.

name: Avatar Karaoke
short_desc: This KTV is indeed the most beautiful and modern one in Ho Chi Minh City! The private rooms are super luxurious. They have renovated the facade and all the rooms. The sound effects are also super good. It is definitely worth recommending. The service attitude is also very good, and the staff are super enthusiastic.

name: Saigon Central Post Office
short_desc: Saigon Central Post Office  The first post office in Ho Chi Minh City during the French colonial period, built in the late 19th century.  Address: 02 C√¥ng x√£ Paris, B·∫øn Ngh√©, Qu·∫≠n 1, H·ªì Ch√≠ Minh 70000 Vietnam Transportation: Bus No. 52, 26, 36 Tickets: Free Time: 07:30-18:00
long_desc: The Central Post Office in Ho Chi Minh City is a French colonial post office built in the 19th century. The exterior of the Post Office resembles an elaborate train station. Wherever you look, everything is intricately designed and decorated. The dates of the Post Office's construction (1886-1891) are inscribed beneath the large clock over the main entrance. Walk into the Post Office and you'll find a spacious lobby with a classically arching ceiling, round windows, hanging chandeliers, and stunningly gorgeous wall lamps, among other decorative features. Beneath the old map on the wall, there are classic phone booths from which you can make international calls. While visiting the Central Post Office, consider mailing a postcard home.
address: 02 C√¥ng x√£ Paris, B·∫øn Ngh√©, Qu·∫≠n 1, H·ªì Ch√≠ Minh 70000, Vietnam

name: H·ªì Ch√≠ Minh City People's Committee
short_desc: Hot scorching sun, heavy traffic with countless motorbikes, but I would still come back here for the coffee, pho, and of course, shopping!!
long_desc: This is the full name of the Ho Chi Minh People's Committee Hall. It is a building with a strong French style. It was built in 1902 and completed in 1908. The city hall has only two floors, with simple lines, red roof and yellow exterior walls, which are particularly bright against the blue sky and white clouds. The building is lively and lively in design, and its details are exquisitely decorated. Sculptures with Western mythological figures and French heroes as the main themes are all over the pillars, door frames, eaves and other parts. Since it is an office, it is not open to tourists, but there is a small square garden in front of the city hall. In the center of the garden is a statue of Ho Chi Minh holding a little girl. Ho Chi Minh was never married and had no children. This statue symbolizes that Ho Chi Minh regarded Vietnamese as his sons and daughters and devoted his whole life without any regrets. Many tourists take photos with the statue and the city hall in the background. At night, the bright lights will be turned on here, which is one of the classic night scenes of Ho Chi Minh City. In addition, there are many vendors selling origami and other gadgets and fruit around the city hall, which is very lively.
address: 86 L√™ Th√°nh T√¥n, B·∫øn Ngh√©, Qu·∫≠n 1, H·ªì Ch√≠ Minh 700000, Vietnam
open_hours: Please contact the attraction to confirm specific opening hours

name: HoChiMinh City Hop On Hop Off Bus
short_desc: Great way to get around the city and see a little bit of everything. Love to go on this bus at night to see the lights throughout the city
long_desc: Ho Chi Minh City Bus Tours offer a convenient and comprehensive way for visitors to explore this vibrant and historic city. As a flexible sightseeing service, the bus allows visitors to experience Ho Chi Minh City's iconic attractions and rich culture in a comfortable journey. The sightseeing bus adopts a double-decker design, and the open top allows tourists to enjoy a panoramic view of the city during the journey. The bus route passes through the main landmarks of Ho Chi Minh City, including the famous Reunification Palace, War Remnants Museum, Notre Dame Cathedral and Ben Thanh Market. Each attraction is Guide by a professional Guide , providing rich information about the city's history, architecture and culture, so that tourists can not only see, but also deeply understand the unique charm of Ho Chi Minh City. Ho Chi Minh City sightseeing bus provides flexible hop-on and hop-off services. Tourists can freely choose the attractions to stop at according to their interests and schedule, and explore the characteristics of each area. Whether it is shopping, Dining or visiting a museum, the bus can easily take tourists to their destination. This sightseeing experience is not only suitable for tourists who are visiting Ho Chi Minh City for the first time, but also for locals who want to rediscover the charm of the city.
address: 210 ƒêi·ªán Bi√™n Ph·ªß, Ph∆∞·ªùng V√µ Th·ªã S√°u, Qu·∫≠n 3, H·ªì Ch√≠ Minh, Vietnam

name: Golden Dragon Water Puppet
short_desc: Tickets were exchanged on site, very fast. There were singing and puppet dancing, very lively. It seemed to be near the Reunification Palace. The location was easy to find and we walked there. The theater was not big, and the view from the front and back was very clear. The children had a lot of fun watching it for about an hour.
long_desc: Traditional water puppetry originating from the rice paddies of the Red River Delta in northern Vietnam remains one of the most popular tourist attractions in Ho Chi Minh City. If you want to truly immerse yourself in the local culture of Vietnam‚Äôs largest city, catch a show at the Golden Dragon Water Puppet Theatre! The theatre is located in Tao Dan Park and performs nightly. The shows are performed entirely in Vietnamese, but the puppetry and accompanying music appeal to foreign audiences as well. An orchestra, usually located to one side of the stage, uses drums, wooden bells, trumpets, bamboo flutes and cymbals to add sound effects and play traditional music, while dragons, fairies and other decorative figures dance on water platforms. Most shows feature humorous depictions of Vietnamese folk tales, legends and important seasonal events, such as the rice harvest.
open_hours: * Opening hours may vary. Please check with the attraction for daily details.

name: Mekong River Cruise in Ho Chi Minh City
long_desc: A cruise on the Mekong River in Ho Chi Minh City is a great way to explore the natural and cultural charm of Vietnam and even Southeast Asia. Scenic experience: The Mekong River in Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam, presents its most charming scenery. Taking a boat tour, you can enjoy the lush tropical plants on both sides of the river, dotted with wooden houses, bamboo houses and small French-style houses with ethnic flavor, forming a series of tropical landscape paintings. Especially in the evening, the afterglow of the sunset sprinkled on the river, shining with golden light, which is beautiful. Boarding Points and Major Stops:Ho Chi Minh Mekong River Cruise offers multiple routes and boarding points, such asEmbark on a wonderful journey along the Saigon River, passing by and admiring the city's landmarks such as Thu Thiem Bridge, Vietnam Telecom Tower and more as you drift down the river. Boat duration:The boat ride lasts about 1.5 to 2 hours, during which time tourists can fully experience the natural beauty and cultural characteristics of the Mekong River. Here you can taste local food, enjoy the unique natural scenery, explore Vietnam and the EastThe charm of South Asia.

name: Shooting Ranges in Ho Chi Minh City
long_desc: Ho Chi Minh, with its unique charm, presents an exciting, professional and comfortable shooting trip for shooting enthusiasts, showing the dynamic vitality of the city and the military cultural heritage. Diverse selection of guns and ammunition: There are a wide variety of guns and ammunition here, from classic AK47 rifles, M1 Carbine, Garand, RPD to civilian pistols such as the Beretta series, and various shotguns. The bullet models are complete to meet the needs of different shooting scenes. Whether it is a novice or an advanced expert, you can find suitable equipment, which is difficult to match in many places. Professional Qualification Certification: Some Ho Chi Minh shooting ranges hold IDPA and IPSC training qualifications, and the coaching team is professionally certified and has rich teaching experience. They can provide precise guidance according to international standards, helping shooters quickly improve their skills and enhance the professionalism of their shooting experience. They provide bilingual services in Chinese and English, and clearly explain gun operation, shooting principles and safety matters. Good safety guarantee: The venue is well-equipped with safety facilities, professional shooting platforms and protective measures, and strict regulations on the storage and use of guns. The coaches have received professional safety guidance and training, and have strong emergency response capabilities. The site is equipped with first aid kits and emergency contact points to ensure that any situation can be responded to quickly and to protect the personal safety of participants. Experience shooting in Ho Chi Minh City, with a variety of guns, professional qualifications, safety guarantees, quality services and comfortable facilities, to create a unique shooting experience for you, leaving you with a deep and unforgettable urban adventure memory.

name: Ho Chi Minh City Museum of Fine Arts
short_desc: Large array of collections to see. The collection of works are top quality but the internal structure could use some renovations as some rooms were good while most hallways deteriorated.
long_desc: The building of the Ho Chi Minh Museum is bright yellow and has an attractive appearance. It was built during the French colonial period in the early 20th century and was jointly designed by Vietnamese and French designers. The main structure of the museum has three floors, and the collection is rich. Art lovers should not miss it. The first floor of the museum displays relevant works of local and international contemporary artists, the second floor gallery displays the collection of contemporary art, including some sketches, paintings and sculptures originating from the colonial period, and the third floor displays older works. There are also collections displayed in the basement.

name: AEON MALL Binh Tan
short_desc: In the shopping mall in the new urban area of ‚Äã‚ÄãHo Chi Minh City, there are fashion stores, sportswear stores, restaurants, supermarkets and a CGV cinema. I bought two black T-shirts in one of the fashion stores. This department store is from Japan. It has supermarkets, cinemas, food courts, etc. It is very fun to visit. There are specials every week. Every week I come here and get unexpected things. There are food, drinks and shopping. But you need a motorcycle to get here, otherwise the transportation is not very convenient.
long_desc: This is a large shopping mall with multiple floors, including different areas such as fashion, food, entertainment and daily necessities. In the fashion area, visitors can find a variety of international brands of fashion, shoes and accessories. In the food area, visitors can taste food from all over the world, including different cuisines such as Japanese, Korean, Italian and Vietnamese. In the entertainment area, visitors can enjoy movies, games and other entertainment activities.

name: Dam Sen Water Park
short_desc: I think this place is always in the memory of Saigonese, many activities for children and adults
long_desc: This is a water park in Ho Chi Minh City that attracts a large number of family tourists and young people. As a modern entertainment facility, the park provides a rich and diverse range of water activities and facilities suitable for visitors of all ages to enjoy a cool and exciting experience. The water park covers an area of about 3 hectares and has multiple theme areas and water rides, including a wave pool, a lazy river, various slides and a children's play area. Among them, the giant slide and the high-speed slide are more popular projects, providing a heart-pounding experience for thrill-seeking tourists. The lazy river in the park provides a leisurely way for tourists to relax and enjoy the relaxation brought by the water flow. In addition to water activities, the park also has dining and rest areas, providing a variety of food and drinks, so that tourists can replenish their energy after playing.

name: HCMC History Museum
short_desc: Informative museum, it has a logical layout - going through historical eras, with a wide array of different exhibits. You can spend an hour to two hours here reading and looking at the exhibits.
long_desc: The History Museum was built by the French in 1929. There are various cultural relics in the cultural evolution process of Vietnam in various periods since 3,300 years in the museum. There are many stone tools, ancient bronzes, stone tablets, bronze drums, Champa art, pottery and ethnic costumes, etc., all of which are very precious. It is a place where you can learn about the history of Vietnam. The museum is mainly divided into two stages, the first stage is ancient Vietnam, and the second part is Vietnam after the establishment of the Communist Party of Vietnam. The display of the first stage is divided into several halls, basically each dynasty in the ancient history of Vietnam is an exhibition hall. The exhibition halls in the second part display many important historical relics of South Vietnam and North Vietnam according to various themes, including ancient pottery. Many of these exhibits are powerful evidences that reflect the ancient culture of Vietnam. In addition, the museum also preserves a large number of important historical relics, and these exhibits are displayed separately from other exhibits. In the three-cuddle library at the rear of the museum, there are also collections of books from the French colonial period, and the research materials are quite rich. In Den Hung, directly opposite the museum, the founding monarch (Hung King) of Vietnam and his ancestors are also enshrined.

name: Saigon River
short_desc: This tour was exceptionally good value for money. The food was good, and it was all labelled in both Vietnamese & English. I believe this trip is a must do trip whilst in Ho Chi Minh City. I would recommend to all, incredibly good bang for your buck.
long_desc: Saigon River originates from Cambodia and runs from the east to the west throughout Ho Chi Minh City,connecting the Mekong Delta. It is the main waterway of Saigon Port. It is nice to take a cruise on the Saigon River. Most cruises offer dinner and performances. Saigon River is quiet during the day. However at night, the lights on the shore shine over the river and it becomes romantic dating site for many young couples.
address: Saigon River, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam

name: Bui Vien
short_desc: the loud music in the street lightens up the mood! food & drinks price are reasonable
long_desc: Pei Yuan Street is like a "United Nations", all-encompassing and everything. The bustling streets are often filled with the taste of fish sauce, curry, cheese and soy sauce. It seems that it has never "slept in", no matter how dim the corner is, the lights are always on, and Peiyuan Street after midnight is even more lively. After renovation, Pei Yuan Street officially became a pedestrian street on the evening of August 20, 2017, becoming the second pedestrian street in Ho Chi Minh City. In addition to providing entertainment and public places for domestic and foreign tourists, there are also two cultural performance stages on Peiyuan Pedestrian Street, providing venues for various festivals, street performances, modern and ethnic music performances.
address: Pham Ngu Lao, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam

name: Master Escape
long_desc: Master Escape is a gaming venue specializing in escape room experiences. Teams of four to ten players enter uniquely themed rooms, typically lasting 60 minutes. Each room features a carefully designed plot, with puzzles ranging from number-based, direction-based, and word-based, encompassing elements of mathematics, chemistry, and history. Players must observe, analyze, and solve clues to escape. Throughout the experience, staff members provide support as "story guides," offering prompts when players get stuck and providing voice narration to help the story progress and ensure a smooth flow. Master Escape's meticulously designed environments, along with authentic interactions with NPC characters, significantly enhance the game's atmosphere. Due to its convenient urban location and its highly praised d√©cor and user experience, it has become a popular choice for group activities, friend gatherings, and corporate team-building events in Ho Chi Minh City.

name: Tao Dan Park
short_desc: i wish my country has a city park as big and as calm as this park. i could just sit here and enjoy everything.
long_desc: This is a beautiful city park. It not only has gardens, lakes, fountains, sculptures and other attractions, but also facilities such as children's playgrounds and sports fields. It is a great place for people to relax and exercise.

name: Saigon Exhibition and Convention Center (SECC)
short_desc: There are many things I don't know because it's Vietnamese, but there are performances and exhibitions. It's like COEX in Korea. I got my vaccine here, and I went to a baby product exhibition and an interior design exhibition, and the interior design was sold between companies.
long_desc: This is an exhibition center capable of hosting various large-scale events, including exhibitions and conferences. It includes a 40,000-square-meter exhibition hall with four entrances and exits, an outdoor plaza ranging from 15,000 to 20,000 square meters, a conference center with a seating capacity of 2,000, an office building, two 400-room four-star hotels, and a 600-room five-star hotel. Furthermore, a large parking lot can accommodate all activities throughout the center.

name: Back beach
short_desc: I have been to Vung Tau many times, and I came and went in a hurry. This time I played seriously and found that Vung Tau's scenery is charming. Every time I come, I have new discoveries and different ways to play. I overlook the whole Vung Tau. [Scenery] Pleasant, continue [Fun]
long_desc: Back Beach is also called Whale Beach. There is a huge whale sculpture on the beach, which is very distinctive. There is also a whale-themed seaside promenade, which is also very eye-catching.

name: Thuy Chau Ecotourism
long_desc: Located in Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam, the Thuy Chau Ecotourism Area is a tourist destination that combines natural beauty with ecological conservation. The area is beloved by visitors for its vast wetland landscape, rich biodiversity, and traditional Vietnamese rural lifestyle. The Thuy Chau Ecotourism Area's main feature is its pristine water village landscape, featuring vast expanses of water, lush vegetation, and winding waterways. Visitors can enjoy the tranquil natural environment by rowing or riding traditional canoes along the rivers. The wetlands and waters are home to a variety of birds, fish, and other aquatic life, making the area an ideal place for observing and photographing natural life. The ecotourism area also preserves traditional local agricultural culture. Visitors can visit local farms and fishing villages to immerse themselves in the Vietnamese rural lifestyle. Visitors can also enjoy authentic Vietnamese cuisine, with many restaurants serving fresh seafood and locally grown ingredients.

name: Mariamman Hindu temple
short_desc: Reasons to Recommend: Ho Chi Minh hidden gem üíé so exciting to find it herewas come for pray üôè
long_desc: Mariamman Hindu Temple is located in Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam. You can see it from Pham Ngu Lao and walking towards the big market. Built at the end of the 19th century, the temple is dedicated to the Hindu goddess Mariamman, and you need to take off your shoes to enter the temple. The whole temple is full of Indian colors, and the statues in the temple also reflect the characteristics of Hinduism, which is very exotic and is a holy place in the hearts of Vietnamese and local Chinese.
address: 45 Tr∆∞∆°ng ƒê·ªãnh, Ph∆∞·ªùng B·∫øn Th√†nh, Qu·∫≠n 1, H·ªì Ch√≠ Minh 70000, Vietnam
open_hours: Please contact the attraction to confirm specific opening hours

name: Vietnamese Cuisine Cooking Experiences in Ho Chi Minh City
long_desc: Ho Chi Minh City invites you to take a cutting-edge cooking class, unlock the secrets of southern Vietnamese cuisine amidst the hustle and bustle, and embark on a journey that will amaze your taste buds. Diverse course content: Usually the course duration is 3-5 hours. Follow the chef teacher to the market to select ingredients, learn about local ingredients, and complete the purchase of ingredients needed for the course. The main cooking content is beef pho, Vietnamese spring rolls, egg pancakes and other specialties, and there are also different sets of dishes for you to choose from. Students can basically make 4-6 signature dishes of Ho Chi Minh City in one class. After completing the course, they can take away exquisite recipes, creative recipe cards and spices to record their unique experience and easily restore the delicious taste when they return home. Small class teaching, excellent teachers: Usually the teaching classes are strictly limited to small classes, with an average of no more than 10 people per class. Small classes ensure that the chefs give meticulous guidance, and students can have in-depth exchanges, stimulate creative inspiration, and explore the boundaries of food together. Most of the chefs teaching are locals, rooted in local cuisine. When teaching, we first share cutting-edge ideas, then provide practical guidance, and accurately control every link, so that students can improve their cooking skills rapidly. Fashionable facilities: The cooking area is spacious and bright, equipped with smart kitchen utensils and professional baking equipment. Drinks and desserts are usually provided, and the finished dishes can also be packed away. The ingredients are sourced from local suppliers and specialty farms, fresh, organic and abundant, adding color to the dishes and ensuring that students can prepare delicious Vietnamese cuisine. Experience a cooking class in Ho Chi Minh CityIt not only provides a profound food experience, but also brings students into a new culinary world through professional teaching. It is not only about making delicious food, but also the best way to experience Vietnamese culture. It helps you become a food trendsetter and leave a unique food memory.

name: Mekong Delta Cruise
short_desc: The Mekong River seems to originate in Cambodia and passes through Ho Chi Minh City. The Saigon River is also the mother river of Ho Chi Minh City, connecting with the Mekong Delta. The Saigon River is also very busy, and the Saigon Port has trade relations with many ports in the world. Taking a cruise on the Saigon River is a must-do activity for every tourist traveling to Vietnam. It is such a wonderful thing to enjoy the beautiful scenery on both sides of the Saigon River while tasting Vietnamese cuisine on the Saigon River cruise.
long_desc: The alluvial soil of the Mekong Delta is quite fertile. The fish and various agricultural products in this area are very rich. The market is full of rice, sesame, peanut, cashew, pineapple, dragon fruit and durian. You'll have countless opportunities to capture stunning landscapes, as well as the locals, as you pass by buffalo plowing orchards and rice fields. You will also have the opportunity to visit a local family and be invited to enjoy local fresh fruits or drinks. The chef will prepare a lunch of many Vietnamese dishes, such as the fried elephant fish unique to the Mekong Delta, as well as the usual food for poor children in local pagodas or schools. Vietnamese Spring Rolls .
address: Bach Dang, Ho Chi Minh

long_desc: The statue of Ho Chi Minh stands in the center of the square, with the old French buildings behind it, and the new modern buildings around are also brilliantly lit. There are many crowds and street performers in the square, and there are many cafes and small businesses on both sides. This is a good place to experience the night view of the city.

The only downside is that the shooting is expensive, $28 for 10 rounds! It was hot when we visited the tunnels so we had to stop halfway. The guide told us that the Vietnam War was only between Vietnam and the United States. But people tend to forget that the Vietnam War was actually a war between North and South Vietnam.

name: Water Puppetry in Vietnam
long_desc: Vietnamese glove puppetry is a unique traditional puppetry performance form that originated in the Red River Delta region in northern Vietnam. Unlike other glove puppetry, Vietnamese glove puppetry is generally performed on water, so it is also called "water puppetry". The performance venue is usually a shallow pool. The puppeteers stand behind the pool and manipulate the puppets with long poles and ropes to vividly perform various storylines on the water. The puppets are flexible and diverse in their movements, and can simulate various human movements such as dancing, fighting and fishing. The stories of Vietnamese glove puppetry are rich and colorful, and are usually based on Vietnamese folk tales, historical stories and rural life. Through humorous performances, the audience can not only enjoy the charm of art, but also understand the culture and traditions of Vietnam. During the performance, the accompaniment of traditional musical instruments and singing on the scene added more vividness and appeal to the puppet show. Vietnamese glove puppetry is not only popular in China, but also attracts a large number of international tourists to watch. In general, Vietnamese glove puppetry is a unique and charming performing art form that showcases Vietnam's rich cultural heritage and folk wisdom through the vivid interpretation of water puppets.

name: Museum of Ho Chi Minh City
short_desc: A city museum located in a two-story French-style building. In terms of the exhibition hall and exhibits, the venue facilities are old and poorly maintained, and the exhibits have no highlights (the opera culture part is a supplement to other museums), and overall it barely passes.
long_desc: The Ho Chi Minh City Museum was rebuilt from the Gia Long Palace built by the French. It was once an important political center of the Vietnamese regime. Now it is open to the public as a museum showing the history of the Vietnamese people's heroes resisting foreign aggression. The museum is a beautiful neoclassical off-white building, built in 1885. The museum displays artifacts from different periods of the Communist Party of Vietnam. It can be seen from some of the French Communist newspapers on display that Ho Chi Minh used the pseudonym NguyenAiQuoc to write for these newspapers during his stay in Paris. Also on display are the aircraft and other weapons used in that year, as well as some photos and documents. Compared with other museums in Ho Chi Minh City, this museum is somewhat inconspicuous, but it is also one of the rare tourist attractions.

It is magnificent and magnificent. The pagoda beside it is also very powerful. There are also stalls selling snacks in front of the temple.
long_desc: Vinh Nguyen Temple is a large temple in Ho Chi Minh City. The road passing through the gate used to be the place where Nguyen Van Chase hero fought against the enemy. When visiting Yongyan Temple on the occasion of the Obon Festival, people can express their devotion to their parents and ancestors, and at the same time, they can participate in activities such as releasing animals and praying for peace.

long_desc: Standing over 260 metres tall, this iconic building is one of Ho Chi Minh City‚Äôs landmarks and an ideal spot for tourists to enjoy stunning views of the city.

name: Cu Chi Tunnel
short_desc: Discover underground village at Cu chi tunnels.¬†Visitors will find it hard to imagine the destruction, damage & defoliation over this whole area, caused by bombing and mines. There is plenty of evidence of the fierce battle that took place here during the 1960s when Cu Chi was a "Free Target Zone".
long_desc: Like an underground village, the Cu Chi Tunnels are one of the three major relics in Ho Chi Minh City. The Cu Chi Tunnels played a surprisingly successful role in the various wars that Vietnam has experienced, so it has become a legendary and popular attraction. The Cu Chi Tunnel is 250 kilometers long and is composed of numerous tunnels less than 80 cm wide, which are divided into three layers, and the third layer is 8 meters deep. Each floor is equipped with air holes extending to the ground indistinctly. There are wells, granaries, conference rooms, and dormitories in the tunnels, like a large military camp. The first floor has to walk in a half-squatting manner, the second floor may have to kneel to advance, and the third floor may even need to crawl forward. Through personal experience, go deep into the authentic, and be shocked by the indomitable national character of the Vietnamese. The tunnel is narrow and there is no room for movement, and it won't take long for you to sweat profusely. The terrain of the Cu Chi tunnels is relatively intact, and the wreckage of helicopters, chariots, and bunkers can still be seen on the ground, quietly spreading in special scenic spots, reminding people of the ruthlessness and cruelty of war.
address: Ph√∫ Hi·ªáp, C·ªß Chi, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam

name: Notre Dame Cathedral of Saigon
short_desc: Vietnamüáªüá≥Ho Chi Minh [Notre Dame Cathedral of Saigon] Notre Dame Cathedral of Saigon  The Red Church is the most famous landmark in Saigon. The Central Post Office is on its left. The church was originally named Saigon Notre Dame Cathedral, also known as the Red Church. All the red bricks used in its construction were shipped from France. After more than a hundred years, the color is still bright and has not faded. Modeled after the design of the bell tower of Notre Dame de Paris, the shape is symmetrical and majestic. The two towers are 40 meters high. In front of the main hall stands a statue of the Virgin Mary weighing 4 tons donated by the Roman Church in 1945  Address: 01 C√¥ng x√£ Paris, B·∫øn Ngh√©, Qu·∫≠n 1, H·ªì Ch√≠ Minh 70000 Vietnam Transportation: Bus No. 36 Tickets: Free Time: Unknown
long_desc: The Saigon Notre-Dame Cathedral Basilica is one of the landmark buildings of Ho Chi Minh City. Located in the heart of the city, it was built in the late 19th century. Featuring typical Gothic architecture, the front has two bell towers measuring 40 meters, which are modeled after the design of Paris's Notre Dame Cathedral. On the garden square in front of the church, there stands a 4-ton Virgin Mary statue which was given as a gift from the Church in Rome in 1945. If, by chance, you happen to visit while Mass is going on, you can quietly enter the church to feel the pious religious atmosphere.
address: 01 C√¥ng tr∆∞·ªùng C√¥ng x√£ Paris, B·∫øn Ngh√©, Qu·∫≠n 1, H·ªì Ch√≠ Minh 70000, Vietnam

name: Saigon Japan Town
short_desc: Vietnamüáªüá≥Ho Chi Minh„ÄêJapanese Street„Äë  Saigon Japan Street is located in Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam. It is an exotic neighborhood that attracts tourists who are interested in Japanese culture. Walking on this street, tourists can feel the strong Japanese atmosphere. There are a variety of Japanese restaurants, cafes and shops on both sides of the street, offering authentic Japanese cuisine and specialty goods. In addition to food, Saigon Japan Street also has some Japanese-style buildings and decorations, creating a unique visual experience. There are also many massage shops, be careful not to be pulled in when passing by.  Address: 8A ƒê. Th√°i VƒÉn Lung, B·∫øn Ngh√©, Qu·∫≠n 1, H·ªì Ch√≠ Minh 700000 Vietnam
long_desc: Saigon Japan Street is located in Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam. It is an exotic neighborhood that attracts tourists who are interested in Japanese culture. Walking along this street, tourists can feel the strong Japanese atmosphere. There are a variety of Japanese restaurants, cafes and shops on both sides of the street, offering authentic Japanese cuisine and specialty goods. In addition to food, Saigon Japan Street also has some Japanese-style buildings and decorations, creating a unique visual experience. Visitors can find a variety of products related to Japanese culture here, such as kimonos, crafts and books, to satisfy their curiosity about Japanese culture. In addition, cultural activities and exhibitions held from time to time in the neighborhood also provide tourists with more opportunities to learn about Japanese culture. Whether it is tasting food, appreciating architecture, or participating in cultural activities, this place can bring a rich and unforgettable experience to every visitor.

name: Saigon Zoo & Botanical Garden
short_desc: Beautiful zoo! Unfortunately, the tiger and elephant enclosures are very small for them so it's sad, but other than that, the animals look well taken care of. The zoo itself feels like a maze as there are many things to do. It is very big so wear comfortable shoes when visiting!
long_desc: Grass Bird Garden is one of the most famous animal and botanical gardens in Southeast Asia, and it is also the largest animal and botanical garden in Vietnam. It has a history of more than 100 years and covers an area of 32 hectares. The origin of the name of the grass bird garden. Most of the tropical plants grown in Vietnam are planted in the botanical garden. It is a large and colorful garden, decorated with rockeries, pavilions and bonsai, which is refreshing and pleasant. The characteristic of this grass and bird garden is that it is planted with huge and lush trees, accompanied by lush green lawns and well-designed flower beds. It covers an area of 33 hectares.
